public class FFTUtil extends Object
first implemented in project http://github.com/nking/curvature-scale-space-corners-and-transformations w/ Copyright (c) 2014 Climb With Your Feet and using The MIT License (MIT) then moved here to share with other projects. NOTE: consider adding Sparse FFT: http://groups.csail.mit.edu/netmit/sFFT/

    • create2DFFT2

      public thirdparty.ca.uol.aig.fftpack.Complex1D[] create2DFFT2(thirdparty.ca.uol.aig.fftpack.Complex1D[] input, boolean forward)
      perform a 2-dimension FFT using the JFFTPack library.
      Parameters:
      input - double array of complex data in format double[nRows][2*nColumns] where the column elements are alternately the complex real number and the complex imaginary number.
      forward -
      Returns:
      two dimensional complex array of size Complex[nRows][input.nCols/2)

    • create2DFFT2

      public thirdparty.ca.uol.aig.fftpack.Complex1D[] create2DFFT2(thirdparty.ca.uol.aig.fftpack.Complex1D[] input, boolean performNormalization, boolean forward)
      perform a 2-dimension FFT using the JFFTPack library. runtime complexity: is O(N*lg_2(N)) for N not power of 2.
      Parameters:
      input - double array of complex data in format double[nRows][2*nColumns] where the column elements are alternately the complex real number and the complex imaginary number.
      performNormalization -
      forward -
      Returns:
      two dimensional complex array of size Complex[nRows][input.nCols/2)

    • create1DFFT2

      public thirdparty.ca.uol.aig.fftpack.Complex1D create1DFFT2(thirdparty.ca.uol.aig.fftpack.Complex1D input, boolean forward)
      perform a 1-dimension FFT using the JFFTPack library. runtime complexity: is O(N*lg_2(N)) for N not power of 2.
      Parameters:
      input - double array of complex data in format double[nRows][2*nColumns] where the column elements are alternately the complex real number and the complex imaginary number.
      forward -
      Returns:
      two dimensional complex array of size Complex[nRows][input.nCols/2)
